{{Advert|date=May 2009}} {{double image|right|Hp touchsmart.jpg|150|Touchsmart pc.jpg|150|The Touchsmart 2 (shown) can be used like a traditional computer (left) or by using the touchscreen (right).}} '''HP TouchSmart''' is a series of [[Tablet computer|tablet PC]] [[laptop]]s and [[touchscreen]] all-in-one [[desktop computer]]s designed by [[HP]]. It features various [[Intel]] or [[AMD]] processors and runs [[Windows Vista]] or [[Windows 7]] as standard.
==HP TouchSmart All-in-One== ===Consumer version=== ====HP TouchSmart Crossfire==== {{Infobox information appliance | name = HP TouchSmart Crossfire | image = [[File:HP TouchSmart trade.jpg|200px]] | caption = HP TouchSmart IQ770 | manufacturer = Hewlett-Packard | type = All-in-one | releasedate = {{Start date|2007|01|07}} | connectivity = FM and ATSC HDTV tuners; Bluetooth, 802.11a/b/g wireless, and gigabit Ethernet connectivity | os = Windows Vista Home Premium | camera = Yes | cpu = AMD Turion 64 X2 TL-52 processor | storage = 320 GB HDD | memory = 2 GB SDRAM | display = 19" Touchscreen | successor = HP TouchSmart IQ500 }}
The HP TouchSmart was first introduced by [[Bill Gates]] on January 7, 2007,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.engadget.com/2007/01/07/microsoft-announces-the-hp-touchsmart-pc/|title=Microsoft announces the HP TouchSmart PC |accessdate=2009-01-28 |last= Dybwad|first= Barb|date= January 7, 2007|publisher=engadget}}</ref> becoming the first mass market touchscreen desktop PC.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.engadget.com/2006/11/30/hp-iq770-crossfire-19-inch-touchscreen-media-pc-revealed//|title=HP IQ770 "Crossfire" 19-inch touchscreen Vista PC revealed! |accessdate=2009-01-28 |last= Block|first= Ryan|date= November 30, 2006|publisher=engadget}}</ref>
Also known as the "Crossfire", the HP TouchSmart IQ770 featured a 19 inch touchscreen, an AMD Turion 64 X2 TL-52 processor, NVIDIA GeForce Go 7600. It had a wide array of ports, including Ethernet, two FireWire, six USB 2.0 ports, one with HP printer power Y-cable connector, 5.1 + digital audio out, IR out, mini-VGA, FM coax, TV coax, ATSC, and two S-Video; however, the IQ770 did not have HDMI ports. PC World gave the machine a "very good" rating of 81/100, but noted that the use of mobile components slowed the computer<ref>Perensen, Melissa J. PC World. Jan 7 2007. Accessdate = 10 August 2009http://www.pcworld.com/reviews/product/29673/review/touchsmart_iq770_pc.html</ref>
====HP TouchSmart 2==== On June 10, 2008, HP unveiled their new HP TouchSmart IQ500 series. The series featured a 22-inch widescreen touchscreen display, an Intel Core 2 Duo processor, a 500GB disk, 256MB NVIDIA GeForce 9300 M HS HD graphics, and 802.11n WiFi, along with an [[Energy Star]] qualification.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.hp.com/hpinfo/newsroom/press/2008/080610xb.html?mtxs=rss-corp-news|title= HP Redefines Home Computing, Putting the Digital Lifestyle at Peopleâs Fingertips with New TouchSmart PCs|accessdate=2009-01-28 |author= Hewlett Packard Development Company, LP|date= June 10, 2008}}</ref> The new TouchSmart featured a sleeker 2 inch profile in a piano-black finish.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.engadget.com/2008/06/10/hp-slips-into-thin-with-touchsmart-2-all-in-ones/|title= HP slips into thin with TouchSmart 2 all-in-ones|accessdate=2009-01-28 |last= Ricker|first= Thomas|date= June 10, 2008|publisher=engadget}}</ref>
The IQ500 series was followed by the IQ800 series, featuring a larger 25.5 inch touchscreen. Other features included a TV tuner with remote, integrated webcam, Bluetooth, HP Pocket Media drive bay and an ambient light to illuminate the keyboard. The more expensive IQ816 featured a 2.10GHz T8100 Core 2 Duo on a 800MHz bus with a 3MB cache, Blu-ray drive / dual-layer burner, and a GeForce 9600M GS chip.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.engadget.com/2008/09/16/hp-announces-the-touchsmart-iq800-series/|title= HP announces the TouchSmart IQ800 series|accessdate=January 28, 2009 |last= Patel|first= Nilay|date= 16 September 2008|publisher=engadget}}</ref> There is a choice of 640GB or 1TB hard drives.
====TouchSmart 300==== The TouchSmart 300 was released on October 13, 2009.<ref>HP http://www.hp.com/hpinfo/newsroom/press/2009/091013xc.html</ref>
====TouchSmart 600==== {{Infobox information appliance | name = HP TouchSmart 600 | manufacturer = Hewlett Packard | type = All-in-one | releasedate = {{Start date|2009|10|22}} | price = Starting at $1049 | connectivity = | os = [[Windows 7]] or [[Windows Vista]] | camera = Yes | power = Energy star | cpu = Intel Core 2 Duo T7450 (2.13 GHz) | storage = 750 GB | memory = 4GB DDR3 | display = 23" | predecessor = HP TouchSmart IQ500/800 }} The TouchSmart 600 was released on October 13, 2009.<ref>HP http://www.hp.com/hpinfo/newsroom/press/2009/091013xc.html</ref>
===Business version=== ====HP TouchSmart 9100==== The HP TouchSmart 9100 is a business oriented all-in-one PC that bears a strong resemblance to its consumer counterpart, the HP TouchSmart 600.
==Tablet== ===TouchSmart tx2z=== Released in December 2008, the [[HP Touchsmart tx2 Series|TouchSmart tx2]] was touted as the first consumer notebook and tablet PC with on-screen [[multi-touch]] control. The TouchSmart tx2 replaced the older [[HP Pavilion (computer)|HP Pavilion]] [[HP Pavilion TX1000 Series Tablet PC |tx]] series.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.notebookreview.com/default.asp?newsID=4741|title= HP TouchSmart tx2 Review|accessdate=January 28, 2009 |last= Jackson|first= Jerry|date= 22 December 2008|publisher=www.notebookreview.com}}</ref>
===TouchSmart tm2=== [[File:HP tm2 laptop.jpg|thumb|right|HP tm2 laptop in slate mode]] The HP TouchSmart tm2 is a convertible laptop, with a multi-touch touch-screen. Converted into slate mode, the tm2 allows artists to draw using the included digital pen and also allows students to take notes in classes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hp.com/united-states/personal_again/press/touch_mini_pr.pdf|title=HP Unveils Touch-enabled Notebook and Minis in Stylish Designs}}</ref>
===TouchSmart Mini 5102=== HPâs first touch-enabled [[netbook]], enabling multitouch gestures and menus. It features an anodized aluminum case in black, red or blue and weights 2.6 lbs. It offers face recognition for easy log-on to [[Windows 7]]. The series features [[Intel Atom]] N450 CPU, mobile broadband, HP video playback and 10 hour battery run time.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hp.com/united-states/personal_again/press/touch_mini_pr.pdf|title=HP Unveils Touch-enabled Notebook and Minis in Stylish Designs}}</ref>
===Slate=== At CES 2010, in conjunction with Steve Ballmer, CEO of [[Microsoft]], HP announced the [[Windows 7]] [[HP Slate PC]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2010/01/06/the-hp-slate/|title=The HP Slate}}</ref>
